channel.title: CPU Heatsink
channel.description:
I am wanting a new one, with my new motherboard my CPU is running hotter (most likely due to the thermal paste but). So links to what you think is a really good heatsink.
Price is irrelevant.
Also if I underclock my Phenom 9750 (2.4GHz) down to 2GHz will this be bad? YES! Its crazy I want to underclock *who in the world does that*.

item.title: CPU Heatsink
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Underclocking causes no harm just like overclocking. The harm in tinkering with voltages and frequency lies in the amount of heat produced. The greater the heat, the greater the chance of something passing it’s temperature threshold.

ps, I’ve underclocked before.

Read full topic

item.title: CPU Heatsink
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

The Phenom 9750 is an AM2+ socket right?

I would just suggest the good ol’ “Big Typhoon” made by Thermaltake. I own it, and my AMD is getting 30-38 idle, and 45-55 load.

I stress tested, and no problems. Also, make sure to reseat your current heatsink, and apply new thermal paste.

Read full topic

item.title: CPU Heatsink
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Speljohan:

If you want one that is silent and well-tested by me (used it for months) i suggest this: Zalman CNPS9500LED Ultra Quiet

sexy fan is sexy, i like mine it cools really well but its fairly noisy

Read full topic

item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

I’ve seen good reviews for the “Thermaltake SpinQ VT” and the “Thermaltake Contac 29”.

item.title: CPU Heatsink
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:3, topic:312271”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=408686.msg3016666#msg3016666 date=1257250126]
If you want one that is silent and well-tested by me (used it for months) i suggest this: Zalman CNPS9500LED Ultra Quiet

[/quote]
That fan looks fucking nice, but looks large, doesn’t it get in the way?[/quote]It will fit in on a normal ATX-motherboard, for me i had to put my RAM in first as a little part of it goes over my 4th ram-slot

item.title: CPU Heatsink
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:1, topic:312271”]I am wanting a new one, with my new motherboard my CPU is running hotter (most likely due to the thermal paste but). So links to what you think is a really good heatsink.

Price is irrelevant.

Also if I underclock my Phenom 9750 (2.4GHz) down to 2GHz will this be bad? YES! Its crazy I want to underclock who in the world does that.[/quote]If you want one that is silent and well-tested by me (used it for months) i suggest this: Zalman CNPS9500LED Ultra Quiet

I’m sure you’ll find some store that sells it. Ps, there’s not point underclocking cpu with one of these. It comes with a separate fan controller as well (fanmate 2) that you plug in between the motherboard and cpu, then you can stick it to the backside of your computer and adjust the fan speed from there with a knob. I have personally never ever needed to turn it up from minimum though, even when doing heavy duty cpu tasks (and on minimum it’s completely silent).

Read full topic
